I don't know if I'm the only one, but when I try to open the keygen, I get a message saying that windows cannot access the file, and I may not have appropriate permissions...tried on XP and Windows 7, tried running as admin...dunno what else to try

I've tested it on many XP and Windows 7 machines, including XP running in a virtual machine. It really sounds like an anti-virus program is blocking it. I use Kaspersky myself and while it takes its sweet time scanning it before it runs, it does let it run eventually.

If turning off your AV makes you nervous, you can run it in a sandbox (use Sandboxie, for example) or a virtual machine and just copy and paste the codes between your machine and the keygen.

Another possibility is that you have debugging or reverse engineering tools running, things like Regmon, etc.

Hi ALoach,
Thank you for an excellent upload.
I have one question, what is the Fingerprint and how do I get a correct fingerprint for my computer?

Probably a bit of a n00b question but I had to ask. *smile*
WKO+ generates the fingerprint for your system and displays it in the registration prompt. You copy and paste that into the keygen and then copy and paste the activation code back into WKO+.

Thanks for the upload.

It really sounds like something is preventing you from running the keygen. AV software is the most common but not the only culprit.

The other possibility is that you have reverse engineering software running.

The keygen works on plenty of PCs (all 5 of mine) so keep trying different computers until you find one where it works.
